Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Recent and current trends in philosophy, including philosophical analysis, phenomenology, structuralism, post-structuralism, and liberation philosophies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Marx & Nietzsche philosophies: outlook & emphasis differences, significant respective critiques of society, implications of contrasting standpoints for understanding human life, philosophical & ideological influences, & contemporary relevance

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHI 2010 or AMH 2010 or AMH 2020 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A thematic and chronological survey of philosophical, religious, and scientific developments in American thought, with primary focus on the American spirit of individualism and reform.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete the following: 
PHI2010 - Introduction to Philosophy (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Major western philosophers and philosophical movements from Descartes to Nietzsche.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The influence of Greek philosophical thought in medieval Muslim, Jewish and Christian philosophy, as expressed in its main problems and representative thinkers.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Foundations of Western philosophy in ancient Greek thinking about human beings and nature, including the pre-Socratics, Socrates, Plato, Aristotle.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Academic Native American philosophy in epistemology, political philosophy and environmental studies.
